Comment: This is really unhelpful. There are ~224,000,000 christians in the US. ~77,330,000 people voted for Trump. There are ~212,000,000 white people in the US. 56% of Trump voters were christian, and 56% of Trump voters were white.    So there is a closer correlation between being white and voting for Trump, than being christian and voting for Trump. But I don't see you saying "if you're white, I assume you run with these idiots", even though that is statistically a safer assumption (though still ill-supported; both groups had less than 1/3 of their membership vote for Trump).
Author: trotptkabasnbi
